review_title: Friends Don't Let Friends Work at SVH
pros:
The health insurance is awesome.
You're paid well ONLY if you're an RN or physician.
cons: Well, let's just say the only pro is the health insurance. Everything else goes here, in the cons section.

pros: They have some great nurses between the PCU and ICU that are willing to work together. The DON and Nurse Leader are friendly and easy to talk to; they have an open door policy and encourage input from their staff.
cons:
SVH has poor salaries for nursing staff. The pay is substandard for the local market.

Also, some of the nurses have been there for 20+ years and are resistant to change. With the recent nurse strike and unfriendly history between the ICU and PCU, there continues to be animosity between some of the nurses in this unit specifically. Teamwork isn't always the name of the game. Although management has been trying to improve the atmosphere of the units, some of the more senior nurses continue to impede those efforts, resulting in a toxic environment at times. In addition, some of the nurses are not willing to precept/train, despite their tenure and SVH's position as a teaching hospital.

SVH can be a great place to work, and upper management and administration seem to be working hard towards improving the overall environment. It will just take some time to overcome the lasting consequences of the strike and get everyone onboard to create a cohesive team.

job_title: Diagnostic Radiologic Technologist in Worcester, MA
pros: I very much enjoy my job at St. V’s! No complaints about Radiology, but Tenet, and the Union.. that’s another story.
cons: Union (Teamsters) doesn’t do crap for us... except take those union dues from our paychecks ($80/month), plus $500 when you first get hired. (BS) Besides that, we pay for parking (& lucky if we find a spot right away)... Medical coverage is OUTRAGEOUS for 24° employees.. better for 32°+ employees, but not great. Tenet won’t budge in making any kinds of adjustments regarding these things. Lost A LOT of good employees in the last year....

pros: Working with and helping patients

job_title: Patient Care Assistant (PCA) in Worcester, MA
pros: Some directors are flexible with schedule.
cons: Rarely have supplies needed. Very few nice coworkers. Never enough staff. Boss changes hours if you don’t punch out at exactly the right time. Have not gotten paid overtime after 7am (unless doing a double) in over a year. Does not notify us if we’ve been in contact with Covid pts. Don’t work here. They don’t care about you.

job_title: Lead Medical Assistant in Brookline, MA
pros: I worked as a CCT in the ED for a little over 5 years and can honesty can say it was and is to this day the best place i have worked. If i hadnt decided to go back to school (which I was inspired to do so by my amazing co workers there) I never would have left, Its a teaching hospital so if you are built for critical care THIS ER is the place to be! I worked with phenomenal, CCT's, nurses, PA's and MD's. The beauty of this ER is you never feel that you are overwhelmed because everyone understands what team work means, It was by far the best co worker experience i have had to this day, because even if you were the only CCT on the floor in ED (due to shortage of staff ) you could always count  on ANY and all staff rolling up there sleeves and having your back. I was consistently learning new things thanks the to fabulous Physicians Assistants, Nurses and providers, I am slowly but shure working on my degree to sometime go to PA school, This place isnt just a workplace, its a family and if i wasnt back in school, I would still be there to this day!
cons: Issues with the union once st Vincents was purchased by tenant and no longer owned vanguard. CCTs also were payed as well as they deserve considering ALL they do during a work day. Unfortunately there seemed to be a shortage of staff almost ALWAS, but the  staff makes up for it with being awesome team palyes!

pros: Awesome co-workers and great work environment
